Posts.Content: virginiamom wrote: I guess I will be joining you here.  I found a hard spot in my right breast earlier in February.  Had biopsy February 13.  Diagnosis was T2 tumor - Invasive Ductal Carcinoma.  Had a breast MRI last Wednesday and went to the surgeon this past Friday.  He said the cancer has already spread to my lungs and I am Stage IV.  I go in for Ct Scan of my chest and abdomen, bone scan and a brain MRI tomorrow.  I have my first appointment with the Oncologist this Friday.   I am very depressed and can't believe this.  I am 39 and have a 6 year old son and a 14 year old daughter.  I have been lurking on your forum for the past few days, but have been too upset to post. Posts.Title: results in kbugmom gma5279

Posts.Content: virginiamom wrote: I went to visit my former co-workers last week.  I still work for the same agency, but I had moved to a new office. I have known some of my former co-workers for over 10 years.  I have not told them that I am Stage IV, but I am sure the word has gotten out. Everyone told me how great I look and that they were surprised because I don't look sick and and two even said "well you haven't even loswt weight.  They expected to see a very sick person crawling into the building I suppose.  There had been 3 people in that office that had gone through cancer and looked very sick and frail when they were battling cancer.   For some reason, this has hit me hard the past few days.  This is the first week, that I have almost felt "normal" since my diagnosis and can go through the day without thinking about cancer from morning to night.  I am on a pain patch and my cough and SOB had gone away (although it is back now).  The problem I am having is that I am receiving what I guess is "Palliative Care" from the Oncologist.  Are we Stage IV women treated the same as a Stage 1 or II patient?  Do they get bombarded with chemo's initially, while we get a lighter version so we can be comfortable and live with the treatments?  I am just talking outloud to my self but am confused.  I am going to see the doctor next Thursday and want to ask him these questions, but don't know how to ask them correctly since I am pretty new at this.  Any thoughts? I hope my post makes sense.  The pain patch makes me feel a bit fuzzy :) Dx 3/2009, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2009 04:32AM virginiamom wrote: I do have lung mets and have these coughing spells.  However some of the cough is from my asthma.  Ask your doctor about these three (1) asthma steroid inhaler and relief inhaler (2) Tessalon perles (medication that works on your airways (3) cough syrup with codiene to give you some relief.  I hope this helps and the doctor is able to give you some relief.

Posts.Content: virginiamom wrote: I posted a few weeks ago that the surgeon thought I had lung mets.  Unfortunately, the lung biopsy and pet and ct scan confirmed it.  This has been a crazy year for me so far.  Found a hard mass on my breast at the end of January, found out in February that I breast cancer, found out in March that I have lung mets.  I will be starting Taxol on Tuesday.  I will get it once a week for an hour for three weeks and then will have a 1 week break.  I have a trip planned with my daughter for April 3 - 6 and am hoping I will be ok to take her on her trip.  The oncologist said the side effects should be minimal because I am getting a lower dose of the Taxol.  I am triple negative. Have been very depressed for the past few weeks.  Got a prescription for Effexor.  Hopefully that will make me feel better. I have been reading all of the posts from you wonderful ladies and am thankful that you are here to guide me and to support me.  I want to be here to support all of you as well. Dx 3/2009, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
